from wikipedia the free encyclopedia jump to navigation search lists of solar eclipses geometry of a total solar eclipse not to scale centuries bc 20th 19th 18th 17th 16th 15th 14th 13th 12th 11th 10th 9th 8th 7th 6th 5th 4th 3rd 2nd 1st ad 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 5th 6th 7th 8th 9th 10th 11th 12th 13th 14th 15th 16th 17th 18th 19th 20th 21st 22nd 23rd 24th 25th 26th 27th 28th 29th 30th eclipses seen from australia china philippines russia ukraine see also lists of lunar eclipses map all coordinates using openstreetmap google maps download coordinates as kml gpx this is a list of solar eclipses in the 7th century bc during the period 700 to 601 bc there were 253 solar eclipses of which 96 were partial 87 were annular one non central 63 were total and 7 were hybrids the greatest number of eclipses in one year was four occurring in 18 different years 699 bc 692 bc 689 bc 685 bc 674 bc 667 bc 656 bc 449 bc 442 bc 638 bc 634 bc 631 bc 627 bc 620 bc 616 bc 609 bc 605 bc and 602 bc three months december 689 bc november 678 bc and october 602 bc had two eclipses date time of greatest eclipse saros cycle type magnitude central duration location path width geographical area ref s 16 57
